column4: how can I fix this: http://paste.ubuntu.com/547670/ it comes up in terminal when I type sudo apt-get update
can you paste your sources.list file?
paste the contents in a pastebin like paste.ubuntu.com
find the line 'sudo apt-get update' in the file you just pasted, delete that line, save, and then sudo apt-get update
I cannot delete it looks like it's read only
run gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list in a terminal
trojan_spike you need to install the 'lsb' package for google earth to work
trojan_spike yes... it is in synaptic... you can install from there (linux standard base/ packagename is lsb)
lsb-base is installed on my ubuntu
trojan_spike well, it didnt.. for me and 2 other guys.. installing it worked for all 3 of us
trojan_spike what KM0201 said exactly... lsb installs lsb-core as a dependancy
